sci sancti viri noi᷍e nomine ·
Alex Alexii · optima vita
Sitteþ stille wiþouten strif
and I schal telle ȝou þe lif
Of an holy man
Alex was his ryȝte name
To serue god God þoute him no schame
ȝ &
þ&combtildevert;of þerof neuere he ne blan·
⧶ his fader was a gret lording
Of romeRome a kynges eueni&combmacr;g euening
ȝ & hyȝtte sire Eufemian
Pore men to cloþe ȝ & fede
In al romeRome þat riche þede
Swich ne wa&slong;ter non
Eche day were in his halle
Leyd þre bordes forto calle
pore men to fede
hem to serue he was wel glad
ȝ & dede as Ihu&combmacr; Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist him bad
þ&combtildevert;fore þerfore he hopede han mede
When þei were serued by ȝ & by
þane at arst was he redy
To gon to his mete
þanne in drede of gode&slong; Godes sone
Wiþ men of religione
he wolde sitte ȝ & ete
his wif hyȝtte dame agles Agles
To seye þe soþe wiþoute les
þͭ þat meche was to prey&slong;e
Bote ȝe myȝtte do þe same maner
þat dede hire lord as y seyde er
Was ȝe nat wel at ay&slong;e

Child hem bi twene ne hadde þei non
þer fore to god God he maden here mon
Boþe be day ȝ & nyȝthe
Ihu&combmacr; Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist herde here bone
ȝ & sente hem a ful god sone
here hertes forto lyȝthe
Wen he was bore þat bli&slong;ful child
Alex boþe mek ȝ & myld
and of maneres hende
A litel after wiþ greth ha&slong;t
þei avoweden to him cha&slong;t
To here lyues ende
þer after was it nat lange
Alex coude speke ȝ & gange
and was set to lere
Sone he was a ful good clerk
ȝ & meche he louede godes Godes werk
fforto speke ȝ & here
Sone whan he gan to belde
ȝ & forto comen to mannes elde
him was cho&slong;en a wif
Out of þe em&pbardes;oures emperoures bour
a mayde good of greth honur
To wedde wiþoute strif
Whan þei were wedded þe fer&slong;te nyȝth
In godes Godes as it was ryȝth
ȝ & was Ibrouth ibrouth to hou&slong;e
Mekliche he gan hire teche
To drede god God · of sinne leche
þat is maydenes spou&slong;e
he prechede hire wiþ al his myȝth
Of sinne ȝe scholde hauen no plyȝth
Bote kepe hire maydenhod
ȝ & of ihu&combtilde; Ihesu þat mayde clene
In whom was neuere wem Isene isene
ȝe scholde habbe hire mede
þan&combmacr;e þanne tok he his gold ring
ȝ & ȝaf þat mayde þat was ȝing
ȝ & seyde to hire þusa And in an abod~The addition is in a later hand. The words "in an" are possibly "an on". The phrase has no relation to the main text, and it looks very much like the scribe was trying out different versions of the letter "a".
Tak þis ring ȝ & kep it me
Til þat godes Godes wille be
God bitwene vs
⧶Whanne he hadde ido as ȝou sey
he tok his leue ȝ & wente his wey
fro þat mayde fre
a parti of his good he wiþ him tok
and al þat oþer he for sok
he wente to þe see
he fond schipes redely
To on he wente priueli
Ouer forto fare
he seyde he was a chapman
ȝ & preyde he mo&slong;te wiþ hem gon
ȝif þat here schip were ȝare
fforþ he wente wiþ godes Godes wille
a fair cyte he com vn tille
þe name I schal ȝou telle
Edissa hatte þat cite
Godes seruant þer to be
þerinne wolde he dwelle
þe goodes þat he wiþ him brougth
Of hem ne wolde he ryȝth nowth
bote ȝaf hem pore menne
his robe he ȝaf þer he sey nede
ȝ & cloþede him sulf in pore wede
ffor no man scholde him kenne
he ȝede to a churche ȝate
þer pouere men sete in þe gate
alme&slong;&slong;e forto take
among hem he sat adoun
ȝ & a&slong;kede wiþ deuocion
Sum good for godes Godes sake
þat churche was of oure leuedy
þer inne was a greth selly
an ymage of hire son
Maked of a wonder werk
þat neyþer lewed man ne clerk
Ni&slong;te hou it was don
þerfore was þider greth sekyng
Of on ȝ & oþer old ȝ & ȝing
Of al þat countre
ffor þi þe pouere þat þer were
Alle þe betere myȝtte fare
þoru here charite·
Alex of þat he myȝtte gete
Nedliche bote þat himself wolde ete
he ne held to his byhoue
To pouere men þat wolde it take
all ȝe ȝaf for gode&slong; Godes sake
þat is in heuene aboue
Nou is alex Alex dwelled þere
his fader at hom seyet ȝ & sore
ȝ & seyþ allas allas
his moder wepuþ nyȝth ȝ & day
ȝ & seyþ allas ȝ & weylawey
þat euere ȝhe born was
his wif wepþ ȝ & makeþ hire mone
ȝ & þus schal lyuen allone
as turtle opon þe tre
Eueremore wiþoute make
Ioye ȝ & bli&slong;&slong;e ȝe wile forsake
Til ȝe hire spou&slong;e se
Nou his fader wiþ dreri chere
he biddeþ his men him comen nere
Als þei willen hauen þere mede
ȝ & preyeþ hem þat þei ben boun
To wende ȝ & sechen his dere sone
In euerich ilk a þede
þat ȝe ne dwelle for no þing
Ar ȝe hauen herd su&combmacr; sum tyding
Where þat he be
Goþ nou swyþe ȝ &
god God ȝou spede
þerfore I schal so god God me rede
ȝiuen ȝou gold ȝ & fee
Nou gon þei forþ
alex Alex sekynd
In diuer&slong;e londes to here tyding
ȝif þei him myȝtte wynne
Somme of hem þoru godes Godes grace
Comen into þat ilke place
þer alex Alex was Inne inne
he sat in pore mene rowe
þerfore couden he hym nat knowe
he ȝaf him charite·

Louerd iherd be þou ay
þat i haue beden þat ilke day
þat I may for þi sake
Of hem þat in myn owene lond
Serueden me to fot ȝ & hond
here alme&slong;&slong;e forto take
Nou þe&slong;e men þat were out sent
aȝen homward þei ben Iwent iwent
To sire eufemian Eufemian
þei swore to him be heuene king
Of alex Alex herde þei noþing tyding
as wyde as þei hadde gan·
In eche a lond þan haue we be
We ne founden no man þͭ þat couþe him se
þat to him coude vs wi&slong;&slong;e
Allas he seyde þat he was born
boþe haue I nou forlorn
Mi ioye ȝ & ek my bli&slong;&slong;e
In þis tale wille we nat dwelle
Bote of alex Alex wile we telle
þat riche pore man·
Alex was pouere mannes fere
ffulli seuentene ȝere
fro þat he bigan
Syttynde in a churche ȝerd
amonges oþere men an herd
In a simple wede
An ymage in þat cherche stod
Of his moder þat deyde on rood
ffor oure alþres nede
Atþe seuentene ȝeres ende

þat ymage of tre
Toþe wardeyn of þe churche
seyde wardeyn ȝif þou werche
Enyþing for me
fleche þou In in my sones man
for seuentene ȝer it is igan
þat he haþ hen þer oute
I þe warne wyterly
To duelle herinne he is worþi
Whar of ne haue no doute
he haþ deserued heuene bryȝth
þe holy go&slong;t is in him lyȝth
ȝiuen him myyȝtte ȝ & grace
þat his preyer wiþ milde stephene

Byfore my sones face
þanne an&slong;uerede þe wardeyn
ȝ & seyde lauedi I wille ful fayn
and I wi&slong;te wilk

þou ne fynde&slong;t þer no mo

And sire ȝif it be þi wille

þe wynd began þe schip to dryue

als it was godes Godes wille
In romeRome þer he was fed ȝ & born

Siþen Ihc&combtilde; Ihesus me haþ hider i brouȝth
In to þis cite
I ne can no betere red of alle
Bote gon to my faderes halle
In pore mannes rowte
I may sitte in þe rowe
þer nis no man þat me schal knowe

Vpon a day sire Eufemian

ȝ & þat nas no ferliche
⧶ þe pope com forþ ȝ & te emperours
Leten him bringe owt of þe hous
ȝ & leyden him on a bere
And beren wiþ gret solempnete
In to þe mydeward of þe cyte
ȝ & cryeden þat alle myȝten here
ȝ & seyden comeþ seþ þis holy man
þat ȝe han south euerichon
here he is in þis place
ffounden he is ȝ & is here
þat holy body on a bere
þoru help of gode&slong; Godes grace
⧶ Alle þat wi&slong;ten of þat cry·
þei ronne þider ha&slong;tifly
ne drou it nowt to abyd
And alle þe sike þat þer were
þat myȝtte touche þe body þere
þei were hol als tyd·
⧶ þe blynde of him hadden here syȝth
þe wode here wyth hadde ful ryȝth
þe halte here lymes lele
þ&combtildevert; þer ne was non þͭ þat þider myȝte wynne
What sykne&slong;&slong;e þat þei were Inne inne
Lat þei ne hadde here hele
⧶ Whan þe emperour him say þͭ þat wonder
he tok þe bere ȝide þervnder
Wiþ þe pope he wende
ffor he wolde ben mad holy
þoru þe bering of þat body
he tok þe bere in hande
⧶ he let sowe in þe cyte
Gold ȝ & siluer gret plente
ȝ & þat was for þis skyl
ffor þe folk scholde hem wiþdrawe
bote þat a vaillede nat an hawe
þey toke no tent þer til
þei preceden euere ner ȝ & nerre
fforto comen to þe bere
þat þe corps lay Inne inne
þei pre&slong;eden þerto wiþ gret fors
þat vnneþe wiþ þat holy cors
To churche myȝte þei wynne
⧶ Whanne þei comen to þe churche
A toumbe of gold he leten wurche
Wiþ precou&slong;e stones
In seue dayes it was dyȝth
fful richeliche al aryȝth
76 237
þei leyden þerinne þe bones
Wan þat holy cors was leyd
In to þe toumbe richeliche Igreyþud igreþud
Wiþ ful meche honour
To alle þat were in þat place
þer com owt þouru godes Godes grace
A ful swete odour
So swete ne smelde þei neuere non
Als so wode as þey hadden gon
Of no spi&slong;erye
þei worchipeden him alle wiþ o stephne
ȝ & þankeden Ihu&combtilde; Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist of heuene
ȝ & his moder Marye
⧶ Nou Ihu&combtilde; Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist þoru þe preyer
Of þat cors seint I tolde ȝou her
ȝif þi wille it be
Graunte vs alle god endyng
And in heuene a wonyi&combmacr;g wonying ·
Amenpar charite
